Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; added white above added red band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hindquarters and part of tail of lion or sphinx to right; red blob on haunch; part of undetermined motif at far left; swastika as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). However, the thickness of this sherd is substantially greater than most light-walled Chian vessels; it may well be from a heavy chalice.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 481)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1339) (phase 2)
